history.proof: hauto use: lb_meet_app, lb_meet_comm, lb_meet_idem unfold: lb_shift.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat
m: lb
l: lb

Goal:
lb_shift n (l ↓ m) = lb_shift n l ↓ lb_shift n m

Premises:
lb_shift = fun (n : nat) (l : lb) => lb_bots n ++ l : nat -> lb -> lb Arguments lb_shift _%nat_scope _%list_scope
lb_shift_S : forall (n : nat) (l : lb), lb_shift (S n) l = ⟘ :: lb_shift n l
lb_nat_shift : forall (n : nat) (l : lb), ⟦ lb_shift n l ⟧ = ⟦ l ⟧ * power n 2
lb_shift_0 : forall l : lb, lb_shift 0 l = l
lb_meet_length_le : forall (n : nat) (l m : lb), length l <= n -> length m <= n -> length (l ↓ m) <= n
lb_meet_cons : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), (x :: l) ↓ (y :: m) = x && y :: l ↓ m
lb_join_length_le : forall (n : nat) (l m : lb), length l <= n -> length m <= n -> length (l ↑ m) <= n
g_nlb_sind : forall P : nat -> lb -> SProp, P 0 nil -> (forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 0 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> P (div n 2) l -> P n (⟘ :: l)) -> (forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 1 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> P (div n 2) l -> P n (⟙ :: l)) -> forall (n : nat) (l : lb), g_nlb n l -> P n l
g_nlb_ind : forall P : nat -> lb -> Prop, P 0 nil -> (forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 0 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> P (div n 2) l -> P n (⟘ :: l)) -> (forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 1 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> P (div n 2) l -> P n (⟙ :: l)) -> forall (n : nat) (l : lb), g_nlb n l -> P n l
lb_meet_app : forall l m a b : lb, length l = length m -> (l ++ a) ↓ (m ++ b) = l ↓ m ++ a ↓ b
lb_pointwise_length : forall (f : bool -> bool -> bool) (n : nat) (l m : lb), length l <= n -> length m <= n -> length (lb_pointwise f l m) <= n
Inductive g_nlb : nat -> lb -> Prop := in_gnlb_0 : g_nlb 0 nil | in_gnlb_1 : forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 0 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> g_nlb n (⟘ :: l) | in_gnlb_2 : forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 1 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> g_nlb n (⟙ :: l) Arguments g_nlb _%nat_scope _%list_scope Arguments in_gnlb_1 [n]%nat_scope [l]%list_scope Arguments in_gnlb_2 [n]%nat_scope [l]%list_scope
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments add (_ _)%nat_scope
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_add : forall n m : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat (n + m) = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m)
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_mul : forall n m : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat (n * m) = BinInt.Z.mul (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m)
in_gnlb_2 : forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 1 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> g_nlb n (⟙ :: l)
in_gnlb_1 : forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 0 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> g_nlb n (⟘ :: l)
lb_meet_comm : forall l m : lb, l ↓ m = m ↓ l
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_lt : forall n m : nat, n < m < -> BinInt.Z.lt (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m)
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_le : forall n m : nat, n <= m < -> BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m)
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.Z0 | S n0 => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_nat _%nat_scope
BinNatDef.N.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.N0 | S n' => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n') end : nat -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.of_nat _%nat_scope
Inductive binary_le : nat -> nat -> Prop := in_ble_0 : forall n : nat, 0 ≲ n | in_ble_1 : forall n m : nat, rem n 2 <= rem m 2 -> div n 2 ≲ div m 2 -> n ≲ m Arguments binary_le (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments in_ble_0 _%nat_scope Arguments in_ble_1 (_ _)%nat_scope
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_iff : forall n m : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat n = BinInt.Z.of_nat m < -> n = m

```coq
intros. induction n using g_nlb_ind.
- simpl. auto.
- destruct (rem n 2) eqn:H.
  + rewrite lb_shift_S. simpl. rewrite IHn. rewrite lb_meet_cons. auto.
  + rewrite lb_shift_S. simpl. rewrite IHn. rewrite lb_meet_cons. auto.
Qed.```

original: intros. induction n using g_nlb_ind. - simpl. auto. - destruct (rem n 2) eqn:H. + rewrite lb_shift_S. simpl. rewrite IHn. rewrite lb_meet_cons. auto. + rewrite lb_shift_S. simpl. rewrite IHn. rewrite lb_meet_cons. auto.
